title: Configuring the name displayed in the To header when reading a message
creator: rdo80241
content:
Hello all,

Here is my environment.

Thunderbird 128.9.2esr (64-bit) running on Windows 10 Home, version 22H2 (with current patches).

I have both a Gmail account, and a Yahoo mail account. I've connected Thunderbird to both accounts. Recently, I made a configuration change somewhere in Thunderbird, and it asked me for my "full name." I put it in, not thinking it would change how incoming emails are displayed because under General->Settings->Message List, I have the "Full name and email address" option checked.

However, for both Gmail and Yahoo, I only see that "full name" that I put into my settings when I read an email message. It does not show the actual name (if any) that is in the email header, nor does it show the email address. Basically, the To header in the incoming message is ignored.

I've checked the account settings for both Gmail and Yahoo. Default Identity->Your Name, hasn't changed for either account. Both names are different from the "full name" that I put in recently. I'd like for Thunderbird to show the actual To header for both accounts.

Does anyone know hot to fix this?

Thanks in advance.

Robert Orosz
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

creator: jos.janssens4
content:
Goede morgen, Ik ben Jos Janssens, mijn mailadres is '***@pandora.be'

Bij het aanvinken van 'ongewenst' worden de mails automatisch verplaatst naar de map 'ongewenst'. Daar worden ze na 31 dagen verwijderd. Dit omdat ik heel veel spam krijg en de map onoverzichtelijk vol geraakt.

Mijn vraag luidt: Bestaat er ergens een lijst van (alle) afzenders die ooit door mij als 'ongewenst' werden aangevinkt? Dit om te kunnen opzoeken of er bepaalde afzenders door mij ten onrechte werden aangevinkt en deze fout te kunnen herstellen?

title: Synch POP account between Thunderbird desktop and Thunderbird Android
creator: shardstrat
content:
Hello. I have been using Thunderbird on my desktop computer and K-9 Mail on my Android phone for several years. I have just updated K-9 Mail to version 9, which is now called "Thunderbird." One of my e-mail accounts is a POP account. Incoming e-mails on this account appear on both devices - desktop and Android - but e-mails that I send via my phone on this account don't appear on the desktop version of Thunderbird. Is there a way I can synchronize ALL the folders on the Android version of Thunderbird with the desktop version?

Thanks in advance for any help. Les

title: One email (of 5) not receiving
creator: roger.munt
content: Having tried this and that (see previous email) I finally got it working by deleting the account XXXXX.XXXXX@lineone.net and then re-creating it. Beside re-specifying the email address and password (exactly as they were before) all the defaults were accepted. So the long and short is that I really don't have the foggiest on what Thunderbird had got hung up on but at least it is working now (for a while..??). Regards, Roger

title: elküldött levél nincs az Elküldött elemek mappában
creator: czinkoczi
content:
Többször előfordult, hogy fáradtságos munkával megírtam egy levelet, majd a Küldés gombra kattintva felugrott a szokásos kis ablak, hogy küldi, és a levél is bezárult. Azonban ezt követően nem találtam sehol a levelet, egyik mappában sem (IMAP), a Piszkozatokban sem. Nem lehetett tudni, hogy elment vagy nem ment el. A szövegre is szükségem lett volna, hisz el akartam menteni a munkámhoz.

Rejtélyes számomra, mi történhetett ebben és a hasonló esetekben. Kicsit ilyesztő, hogy a jövőben akkor előbb mentsem el a szöveget, ha levelet írok, mert ez benne van a pakliban?...

A vezetékes internetkapcsolatom szinte tökéletes. És ha megszakadt volna épp a küldés pillanatában, akkor is meg kéne legyen a levél. Nyitott vagyok bármilyen javaslatra. És az is nagyon érdekel, hogy be tudnám-e állítani a legújabb Thunderbirdben valahogyan, hogy pl. percenként mentse a levelemet, amíg nem küldöm el.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/135.0.0.0;kb_visits_prior:["/hu/kb/thunderbird-billentyuparancsai"]

title: problema mail aruba
creator: casadellelettronica
content: Buon pomeriggio, da sempre Uso thunder per gestire le mail. ho tre pc dove e' installato e ho configurato le mail. Sul portatile ho cambiato HD e ho reinstallato i programmi , da allora non riesco piu' a configurare su Thunderbirds la mia email con dominio di Aruba, mail normalissima, non PEC. Sugli altri PC funziona benissimo mentre sul portatile dove e' stato reinstallato continua a dirmi "Impossibile autenticarsi al server. la configurazione, il nome utente e pass, potrebbero essere errati. Ho copiato pari pari le configurazioni presenti negli altri pc ma niente. Quando creo il nuovo profilo su Thunderbirds inserisco nome, user (la mail completa) e la password. Fa una prima verifica per trovare le configurazioni, e mi da il suo risultato, ho provato a lasciare quelle impostazioni, a metterle manualmente, a usare quelle che mi da aruba, a mettere quelle presenti nei pc in cui la mail funziona... ma nulla. Non ho mai avuto problemi, ma sono da due settimane sono in crisi. Sal server diretto di Aruba entro senza nessun problema con queste credenziali, negli altri PC senza aver modificato nulla tutto ok, nel portatile nuovo nulla. Si sono configurate tutte le mail (Anche quelle ARUBA PEC) ma non questa con dominio. Potete aiutarmi? Grazie
